results.title: Up a tree
results.brief_description: Donald the lumberjack decides to saw down the tree in which Chip ‘n’ Dale live. A whirlwind of comedy ensues as the chipmunks proceed to deter the determined duck in any way they can.

results.title: Fire chief
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: First released in 1941, this film features the best from the second decade of the “Donald Duck” cartoons. This short is filled with one clever gag after another as Donald has a go at being fire chief.

results.title: Three decades of Donald Duck: Donald's nephews

results.title: Foods and fun: a nutrition adventure
results.creator_credit: Rick Reinert and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Animated film explaining the basics of good health: rest, exercise and a balanced diet. Stresses the need to start the day with a good breakfast. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Celebrations
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: A documentary film presenting six different and authentic celebrations involving people in the multicultural community of Melbourne. Depicts an Aboriginal dance showing body decoration preparation, an Indonesian Muslim wedding celebration, an Australian child’s birthday party, a Greek nameday party, Christmas festivities and a Northern Italian Christmas celebration. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Battleship Potemkin
results.brief_description: This full length version of one of the most important films in the history of silent cinema portrays the mutiny aboard the Russian battleship Potemkin and the role of the sailors and citizens of the Port of Odessa in the abortive revolution of 1905. It brought to the attention of the world the theories of Sergei Eisenstein, his emphasis on montage, stress on intellectual content and his treatment of the mass instead of the individual as protagonist. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students.

results.title: The Negro soldier
results.creator_credit: Frank Capra, Stuart Heisler and United States. War Dept.
results.brief_description: World War II propaganda film, outlining the Negro soldier’s participation in war and America history from 1776 to 1944, glossing over issues such as racism and segregation. Acclaimed for its dignity and sincerity when it was released, it now offers a historical perspective of stereotypes and racial attitudes held by the military and the public during the war. Music by Dimitri Tiomkin performed by the Army Air Force Orchestra. Written by Carlton Moss.

results.title: Proud to live
results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Zelda Rosenbaum and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Based on interviews with seven survivors of the Nazi holocaust, this documentary presents their struggle to resist degradation and their determination to survive.
